intro: Rhynchospora hirsuta, commonly known as hairy spikegrass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, cylindrical stems covered in fine, hairy texture. The plant produces spike-like inflorescences bearing small, three-lobed flowers, which are usually pale green to reddish in color. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies in suitable moist environments. Rhynchospora hirsuta plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wetland organisms.
